Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 16: The Bodhisattva takes Mṛgajā in marriage
As he was traversing the city in order to return to the palace,
Manual - English: Again, near a mansion, the Buddha rides in a carriage.  Mṛgajā (ri dwags skyes ma) sees the Buddha from a window at the mansion. The Buddha throws his pearl rosary which lands around her neck. In a mansion, the Buddha takes Mṛgajā as his bride.

Sun of Faith - English: the Bodhisattva caught sight of the daughter of Kalasadhu (Dus legs),  a remarkable woman named Mrga-ja (Ri dwags skyes), who was gazing at him from her window.
She said: "O, a Miracle! This man's mother is lucky indeed, and fortunate, his father.
I call him a Miracle, for the one who marries him will rise beyond suffering."
The Bodhisattva's heart brimmed over with joy on hearing the words “will rise beyond suffering.”
He flung his pearl necklace towards the young woman. The ornament floated through the open window
and fastened itself round Mrga-ja's neck.
and recounted it to his father,
who invited Mrga-ja and her twenty thousand ladies-in-waiting to marry the prince.
Thus Siddhartha found himself surrounded by sixty thousand wives: three principal queens, each possessing twenty thousand followers.
